title: Merritt Island man arrested on manslaughter charge
content:
A Merritt Island man is accused of accidentally shooting another man in the head in Cocoa Beach Friday evening, police said.
Leonard Lopez, 58, faces a manslaughter charge in the death of John McLean, 53, Sgt. Manny Hernandez said.
Police found McLean dead in Lopez's car at 7:49 p.m. Friday with a gunshot wound to the head, Hernandez said. The car was in a parking lot at 150 Minutemen Causeway.
"This is certainly a tragic event," Cocoa Beach Police Chief Scott Rosenfeld said in a statement on Tuesday.
Police investigated through the weekend and arrested Lopez at his home at about 9 p.m. Monday.
Hernandez declined to say what lead investigators to believe McLean's death was an accident, saying investigators are still working the case. Anyone with more information about the case can call Cocoa Beach police at 321-868-3251.
Lopez is being held on no bond in the Brevard County Jail.
glotan@orlandosentinel.com or 407-420-5774
